com.safenetinc.luna

Class LunaLogging

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Formatter
      • com.safenetinc.luna.LunaLogging

  • public class LunaLogging
extends java.util.logging.Formatter
    A JSP logging framework utilizing the java.util.logging package built within any JVM

      Constructors

      LunaLogging()

      static java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
      Gets a logger whose category is the full name of the calling class.
      static java.util.logging.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String aInClassName)
      Either set the created logger with a new temporary handler and subsequent formatter or override the root logger of the JVM overridesystemlogging - This means that the Luna logging code will explicitly manage the logging handlers and formatters as opposed to the default mechanism.
      static void overrideRootLogger()
      override the root logger's (the JVM's JUL logger) handlers' log message formatters Don't do this if LunaProvider is being used within a more complex application environment like JBoss or another application server where they are employing more elaborate logging mechanisms.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.logging.Formatter

        formatMessage, getHead, getTail

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.util.logging.LogRecord record)
        Format the raw record data input according to a prescribed MessageFormat above.
        Specified by:
        format in class java.util.logging.Formatter
        Parameters:
        record - the record record to be formatted
        Returns:
        a formatted string to be published

      • overrideRootLogger

        public static void overrideRootLogger()
        override the root logger's (the JVM's JUL logger) handlers' log message formatters Don't do this if LunaProvider is being used within a more complex application environment like JBoss or another application server where they are employing more elaborate logging mechanisms.

      • getLogger

        public static java.util.logging.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String aInClassName)
        Either set the created logger with a new temporary handler and subsequent formatter or override the root logger of the JVM overridesystemlogging - This means that the Luna logging code will explicitly manage the logging handlers and formatters as opposed to the default mechanism. This should only be used if something interferes with the LunaLogging system otherwise leave it alone as basic JUL should work just fine with LunaLogging.
        Parameters:
        aInClassName - the calling class name
        Returns:
        Logger for calling class

      • getCallingClassName

        public static java.lang.String getCallingClassName(java.lang.Throwable aInThrowable,
                                   int aInLevel)
        Gets the name of the class that created the throwable. 
         E.g. for a stack trace as follows:
 A.a()
 B.b()
 C.c()
 LunaLogging.getCallingClassName(new Throwable(), n)
 For n = 0 "C" is returned; for n = 1 "B" is returned.
        Note that this is a fairly expensive operation!!!
        Parameters:
        aInThrowable - the exception to process
        aInLevel - the number of levels above the caller to extract
        Returns:
        the caller's class name

      • getCallingClassName

        public static java.lang.String getCallingClassName(int aInLevel)
        Gets the name of the class calling the caller of this method. 
         E.g. for a stack trace as follows:
 A.a()
 B.b()
 C.c()
 LunaLogging.getCallingClassName(n)
 For n = 0 "B" is returned; for n = 1 "A" is returned.
        Note that this is a fairly expensive operation!!!
        Parameters:
        aInLevel - the number of levels above the caller to extract
        Returns:
        the caller's class name

      • getLogger

        public static java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
        Gets a logger whose category is the full name of the calling class. 
         Intended for use as:
 private static final Logger logger = LunaLogging.getLogger();
        It is an expensive operation to determine the calling class, so avoid creating transient loggers with this.
        Returns:
        a logger
